p.span: If your child is unable to participate in virtual learning because of illness, please call your school attendance line.Â When you leave a message on the attendance line, please include:

li.span: Whether your child has received a doctorâs diagnosis for the illness

p.span: If your child is not able to participate in virtual learning days because of a reason that is not an illness, please also call your school attendance line.Â When you leave a message on the attendance line, please include:

li.span: The reason your child cannot participate

p.span: If you need help accessing technology devices, please complete the

strong.span: If you need support for your device, please contact our Technology Team at

span.a: DPI Resources for assistance with internet connectivity at home

br.span: Spectrum is offering free broadband internet and WiFi access for 60 days to families with K-12 and college students.Â Installation fees for new households will be waived. 844-488-8395

strong.span: NEED HELP AND NOT SURE WHO TO TALK WITH?

span.span:
Hartland North School Office:Â Jeannette Betker, jbetker@hartlake.org or 262-369-6710
Principal, Heather Grindatti:Â hgrindatti@hartlake.orgÂ or 262-337-2134

hr.p:
Hartland South Office:Â Heidi Kafkas, hkafkas@hartlake.org or 262-369-6720
Hartland South Principal, Dave Risch:Â drisch@hartlake.orgÂ or 262-424-5309
North Shore Middle School Office:Â Judy Cieminski, jcieminski@hartlake.org or 262-369-6767
North Shore Middle School Principal, Michele Schmidt:Â mschmidt@hartlake.orgÂ or 262-408-0852
District Office, Michele Davis:Â mdavis@hartlake.orgÂ or 262-369-6746
Guidance, Heather Whelan:Â hwhelan@hartlake.org
FOOD RESOURCES:
Free and Reduced Lunch Application âÂ If you currently qualify for free and reduced lunch/breakfast, please contact Maureen Lawler at mlawler@hartlake.org if you would like to participate in receiving breakfast/lunch âgrab and go bagsâ during the online learning/school closure time.Â Â If you would like a paper copy of the Free and Reduced Lunch Application, please contact Maureen Lawler at mlawler@hartlake.org.

Saint Charles (St. Vincent de Paul) Food Pantry, 229 Lawn Street (at the corner of Church and Lawn), 262-367-0800. The pantry is open every Tuesday morning from 10:00 am â 12:00 pm and every second and fourth Tuesday from 5:30 â 7:00 pm.

p.span: Hartland Food Pantry, 555 S. Industrial Drive, 262-367-6373.Â The pantry is open Wednesdays from 1:30 â 3:00 pm and Saturdays from 10:00 â 11:00 am.Â Provides temporary and emergency food assistance to anyone in need in the AHS School District.Â Clients may visit 2 times/month and must show proof of need after the 8th visit.

hr.p: Pewaukee Food Pantry, 642 Main Street, Pewaukee, 262-893-8241.Â Hours are 10:00 â 11:00 am every Wednesday and Saturday.
Food Pantry of Waukesha County, 1301 Sentry Drive, Waukesha, 262-542-5300.Â Open for grocery distribution M-F from 1:00 â 3:00 pm, Thu. from 6:00 â 8:00 pm, and Sat. from 9:30 â 11:30 am.

br.span: 211 Wisconsin â COVID 19 Information and Resources ranging from medical concerns, financial assistance, etc.

span.a: WE Energies
How to Talk to Kids About COVID-19

br.a: COVID-19 Parent Handout for Talking to Children

span.a: COVID-19 Helping Families and Children Cope
Taking Care of Your Family During COVID-19
What To Do (And Not To Do) When Children Are Anxious
Rainbow Breathing (Go Noodle)
How to Make a Sensory Bottle
Guided Imagery for Kids
Mindful Breathing

p.span: Waukesha County Crisis Intervention During regular business hours, contact the outpatient clinic at (262) 548-7666 and ask to speak with a crisis worker. During non-business hours, contact Waukesha County hotline at (262) 547-3388 and ask to speak with a Waukesha County mental health crisis worker.
SAMHSA Distress Helpline at 1-800-985-5990 for help if youâre feeling overwhelmed with emotions like sadness, depression, or anxiety

Family Services of Waukesha: 262-567-4455 â¢ Family Service is an independent, non-profit counseling center that provides state-of-the-art psychotherapy, education, and advocacy services to anyone needing help across lifeâs continuum â every age, every stage. â¢ At Family Service, we know that mental and emotional health is the basis for confident individuals, good parents, happy children, strong families, and productive communities.

Gals, Institute, LLC: 262-337-9770 Gals Institute is a collaborative group of licensed clinicians providing therapy services, resiliency building workshops, one day events, and support groups in the Lake Country Area. They have a team of 13 providers consisting of clinical and in-training licensed therapists who bring an incredible wealth of knowledge and expertise in their care for families. Additional clinical team members include a registered licensed dietician and all clients have access to their Mental Health Prescriber (NP)

p.br:
211 Wisconsin â COVID 19 Information and Resources ranging from medical concerns, financial assistance, etc.
Waukesha County Public Health COVID-19 Information
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention COVID-19 Information

span.strong: HOW CAN I HELP SUPPORT FAMILIES IN NEED?

p.br: COVID-19 Angel Fund â Funds will be used to purchase gift cards for groceries and other essentials for HLSD families in need.Â Donations are being accepted through e-Funds.

Hartland, Wisconsin 53029
